name: In Vitro Neurodegenerative Disease Models
definition: For studying diseases like Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, Huntington's, and ALS

name: Histone Modification Analysis
definition: Studying the chemical modifications of histone proteins, which affect chromatin structure and gene expression.

name: Protein Mass Spectrometry

name: Exosome Research Services
definition: Exosome Isolation and Purification, Exosome Identification, Exosome Quantification, Exosome Analysis, Exosome Applications

name: PCR Reagents and Raw Materials Manufacturing
RNA Design
definition: Custom design and synthesis of novel RNA with specific functions

name: In Vitro Toxicology
definition: Use of cell cultures and organotypic models to evaluate toxicity

name: Microscale Thermophoresis (MST)
definition: Quantification of biomolecular interactions in solution based on thermophoresis

name: RNA Sequencing (RNA-Seq)
definition: Quantifying, profiling, and identifying novel RNA transcripts; analysis of gene expression, alternative splicing, and post-transcriptional modifications

name: Biologics Scale-Up Development
definition: Translating small-scale culture processes to larger bioreactors while maintaining cell viability and product consistency

name: Computational Biology

name: Tissue Biobanking
definition: The collection, preservation, and storage of tissue samples for research and clinical use, enabling the study of tissue-specific diseases, biomarker identification, and therapeutic development.

name: Metabolite Profiling Data by NMR
definition: Analyzing the metabolic profile of a biological sample using Nuclear Magnetic Resonance spectroscopy to identify and quantify metabolites.

name: Liquid Dosage Forms

name: Protein Function Assays

name: Network Biology and Pathway Analysis
definition: Network biology and pathway analysis for understanding complex biological systems

name: Biomarker Identification
definition: The process of detecting and validating specific biological markers indicative of particular health conditions or diseases.

name: Chromatography
definition: Headspace GC-MS (HS-GC-MS), Purge & Trap GC-MS (PT-GC-MS), Pyrolysis GC-MS (Pyr–GC-MS), Gel Permeation Chromatography (GPC, SEC), Ion Chromatography (IC)

name: Regulatory Affairs and Compliance
definition: Ensuring that all testing and documentation comply with regulatory standards (e.g., FDA, EMA) and assisting in regulatory submissions.

name: Antibody Conjugation and Labeling
definition: Conjugation of antibodies with fluorescent dyes, enzymes, or other molecules for various applications

name: Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM)
definition: A high-resolution imaging technique that uses a mechanical probe to scan the surface of a sample at the nanoscale, providing detailed topographical maps and information about the physical properties of materials.

name: Target Identification High-Throughput Screening (HTS)

name: Pesticide Residue Testing
definition: The analysis of food items for the presence of pesticide residues, ensuring that they are within permissible levels and compliant with safety regulations.

name: Copy Number Analysis

name: Protein Biomarker Discovery

definition: Tests to confirm the identity and ensure the purity of viral vectors and cell lines, verifying that they meet specifications and are free from contaminants.

name: Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM)

name: Guinea Pig Models
definition: Used for specific types of research where rodents are not suitable.

name: Plasmid Production
definition: Subcloning, plasmid construction, and vector design.

name: Immune Cell Assays
definition: Immune cell assays are tests used to evaluate the function, response, or characteristics of different types of immune cells.

name: Multiplexed Isobaric Tagging (e.g., TMT, iTRAQ)

name: Gene Therapy Bioanalytical Assays

name: SNP Genotyping

name: Clinical Toxicology
definition: Assessment of adverse effects in humans, including overdose and exposure to toxins

name: Respiratory Disease Models

name: Toxicology and Safety Pharmacology
definition: Early safety assessments including in vitro genotoxicity and cardiotoxicity screens

name: In Silico ADME Prediction

name: Bispecific and Multispecific Antibody Development

name: Small Molecule Chemical Synthesis
definition: The process of designing and producing small molecule compounds through chemical reactions, aiming to create APIs with desired properties for pharmaceutical applications.

name: Environmental Impact Mitigation
definition: Developing mitigation strategies to reduce negative impacts of projects

name: VLP Vector Production and Packaging
definition: Development and purification of VLP (virus-like particles) vectors and packaging of cargo into VLPs

name: Metabolic Flux Analysis

Protein Extraction

definition: A cell-free process to produce RNA by enzymatic reactions

name: Exome Sequencing
definition: Targeted sequencing of the exome,

name: Particle Engineering

name: Cytology

name: Modeling of Biological Processes

name: Biomarker Discovery
definition: Identifying biological molecules that serve as indicators of a particular disease state or physiological condition.

name: Target Knockdown/Knockout Studies

name: Imaging Biomarkers
definition: Development of biomarkers based on imaging techniques such as MRI, PET, and CT scans

definition: Studies on how formulation, dosage form, and other factors affect absorption of ingredients

name: Solution-Phase Peptide Synthesis

definition: The process of obtaining biological samples from various sources, including donors and clinical settings, to support research and development activities.

name: SAR (Structure-Activity Relationship)

name: Circular Dichroism (CD) Spectroscopy

name: Antibiotic Discovery
definition: Screening for novel antibiotics

name: Protein Design

name: Antigen Design and Selection

name: Purity and Impurity Profiling

name: Metabolomic Biomarker Discovery

name: Fermentation Technology
definition: For microbial systems, optimizing fermentation conditions to maximize product yield.

name: Biologics Cell Line Development

name: Screening for Immune Modulators

name: Mass Spectrometry

name: Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometry (AAS)

name: Polymer Synthesis
definition: Creating custom polymers for various applications, including materials science and biotechnology

name: Quantitative Proteomics
definition: Measuring and comparing the quantities of proteins in different samples to study cellular processes and disease states.

name: Gene Therapy Off Target Effect Analysis
definition: Identifying and assessing unintended genomic modifications that occur outside the target site during gene therapy

name: Innate Immunity Animal Models
definition: These are animal models used to study the innate immune system, the body's first line of defense against infection, through genetically or experimentally modified organisms.

name: Microbiological Testing of Nutraceuticals
definition: Testing for pathogens, spoilage organisms, and microbial contaminants in nutraceutical products

name: Target Testing with Disease Models
definition: Testing the efficacy of candidate drugs using relevant animal models

name: DNA Pooled and Arried Library Services
Nanobody Production
definition: Generation of single-domain antibodies, typically from camelids

name: APIs Solid Form Screening and Selection
Solubility Profiling and Enhancement
definition: Solid Dispersion Techniques: Utilizing carriers to increase the solubility of poorly soluble drugs.Cyclodextrin Complexation: Using cyclodextrins to enhance solubility and stability.Micronization: Reducing particle size to improve solubility and dissolution rate.

name: Bioinformatics for Biomarker Analysis
definition: Use of computational tools to analyze large datasets from genomics, proteomics, and metabolomics studies

name: Custom Buffers, Solutions and Reagents Manufacturing
Cytotoxicity Testing
definition: In vitro cytotoxicity assays for evaluating drug safety.

name: Immune Cell Proliferation Assays
definition: Immune cell proliferation assays assess the rate of growth and division of immune cells, often used to evaluate immune responses or the effect of drugs on these cells.

name: Whole Genome Sequencing
definition: High-throughput sequencing of entire genomes; resequencing for variant identification

name: Custom CHO, Hybridoma and Insect Cells Media Manufacturing
Flexographic printing, Film and Laminate Manufacturing
Modified Oligonucleotide Synthesis
definition: Modifications like fluorescent labeling, phosphorylation, and conjugation

name: 10X Genomics Provider
definition: Services utilizing 10X Genomics technology, including single-cell and spatial transcriptomics, to provide high-resolution insights into cellular diversity, gene expression, and tissue architecture.

name: DNA Methylation Sequencing (Bisulfite Sequencing) Analysis
definition: Evaluating DNA methylation patterns using bisulfite sequencing to understand gene expression regulation and epigenetic changes.

name: Environmental Toxicology
definition: Assessment of the impact of substances on the environment and wildlife

name: Laser Microdissection and Pressure Catapulting (LMPC)
definition: For single-cell analysis

name: Target Functional Assays
definition: For assessing the impact of target modulation on relevant cellular processes, including proliferation, migration, and signal transduction

name: Pharmacovigilance
definition: Monitoring drug safety in clinical trials

name: Allergen Testing
definition: Diagnostic tests to identify specific allergens causing allergic reactions, often through skin prick tests or serum-specific IgE tests.

name: Contaminant Testing
definition: The detection and analysis of harmful substances, such as heavy metals, pathogens, or industrial chemicals, in food products to ensure they are safe for consumption.

name: Stability Testing
definition: The evaluation of a product's stability over time under various environmental conditions to ensure it maintains its quality, efficacy, and safety throughout its shelf life.

name: Industrial Hygiene Testing
definition: The assessment of workplace environments to identify and measure exposure to hazardous substances, ensuring compliance with safety standards and protecting worker health.

name: Extractables and Leachables (E&L) Studies
definition: Evaluating potential interactions between drug products and packaging materials

name: Antibody-Drug Conjugate (ADC) Production
definition: Design and engineering of ADCs with optimal antibody selectivity, linker stability, and drug payload potency, with cell culture, and purification processes

name: Small RNA and Non-Coding RNA Sequencing
definition: Sequencing, analysis, and study of small RNAs, such as miRNAs, siRNAs, piRNAs, and lncRNAs

name: Electrophysiology
definition: Patch-clamp, multi-electrode array (MEA), and EEG studies for neuronal activity analysis

name: Neurotoxicology for Neuroscience Studies
definition: Assessment of neurotoxic effects of compounds and environmental factors

name: Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM)
definition: For producing detailed, magnified images to determine composition and physical features

name: Bacterial Fermentation and Bioprocessing
definition: Development and validation of bacterial fermentation processes for the production of bioproducts

name: Urogenital Disease Models
definition: Research focused on pharmacological interventions and therapeutic approaches for diseases affecting the urogenital system, including urinary tract infections and reproductive disorders.

name: Chemical Optimization
definition: Optimization of synthetic routes for efficient production of lead compounds

name: Large-Scale API Synthesis
definition: Synthesizing chemicals and scaling up production for larger studies or preclinical testing.

name: Radiochemistry
definition: A crucial part of radiopharmaceutical development, involving the chemical processes to incorporate radioisotopes into pharmaceutical compounds.

name: Skin Microbiome Analysis
definition: Examination and characterization of the microbial communities residing on the skin

name: Inhalable Product Development and Testing
definition: Determination of Aerodynamic Particle Size Distribution (APSD) and Delivered Dose (DD) for Dry Powder Inhalers (DPI) and Metered Dose Inhalers (MDI). Inhalation toxocology

name: Reference Standard Synthesis
definition: Production of high-purity chemical standards used as benchmarks in analytical testing, ensuring the accuracy, reliability, and consistency of experimental results and quality control processes.

name: Combinatorial Chemistry
definition: Creation of large libraries of compounds for high-throughput screening

name: UTI (Urinary Tract Infection) Screening
definition: Diagnostic tests to detect bacterial infections in the urinary tract, often using urine culture or rapid test methods to identify pathogens and guide treatment.

name: Viral Load Testing
definition: Measurement of the amount of viral RNA or DNA in a patient's sample, used to monitor the progression of viral infections and the effectiveness of antiviral treatments.

name: Neurodevelopmental Studies
definition: Research on the development of the nervous system and neurodevelopmental disorders

name: ADMET Optimization
definition: Optimization of absorption, distribution, metabolism, excretion, and toxicity properties of drug candidates

name: Endotoxin and Pyrogen Testing
definition: Methods to detect endotoxins and pyrogens in pharmaceuticals and biologics, ensuring products are free from fever-causing contaminants and meet safety standards.

name: Documentation and Batch Record Review
definition: The examination of production documentation and batch records to verify that manufacturing processes are properly documented and that products are manufactured in accordance with established procedures and regulatory requirements.

name: Behavioral Animal Models
definition: For studying the effects of drugs on animal behavior, often in the context of neurological or psychiatric conditions.

name: Green Chemistry
definition: Development of environmentally friendly synthesis routes

name: Amplicon Sequencing
definition: A targeted sequencing method that amplifies specific regions of DNA through PCR, allowing for detailed analysis of genetic variations and mutations within those regions for research and clinical applications.

name: Cytokine Release Assays
definition: Cytokine release assays measure the amount of cytokines released by cells in response to a stimulus or treatment.

name: Stable Cell Line Development and Characterization
definition: Creation of stable cell lines for research and bioproduction and characterization for phenotype, genotype, and functional properties.

name: Molecular Pathology
definition: PCR and other molecular techniques for detecting genetic mutations, translocations, and expression levels

name: Site-Directed Mutagenesis
definition: Making specific and intentional changes to the DNA sequence of a gene, allowing researchers to study the effects of these mutations on protein function and gene expression.

name: Long Read Sequencing/Single Molecule Sequencing (SMS)
definition: Advanced sequencing technologies that read long stretches of DNA or RNA molecules in a single pass, offering improved accuracy in detecting structural variants, repetitive regions, and complex genomic features.

name: Hydrogen-Deuterium Exchange (HDX) Mass Spectrometry
definition: Studying protein dynamics and interactions

name: Optogenetics
definition: A technique that uses light to control cells within living tissue that have been genetically modified to express light-sensitive ion channels, enabling precise manipulation of neuronal activity for studying brain function and behavior.

name: Drug Neurotoxicology Analysis
definition: Evaluations of adverse effects of chemical and biological agents on the nervous system

name: Chemoinformatics
definition: Use of in silico methods for compound screening, modeling, and prediction of ADMET properties

name: Toxicology Animal Models
definition: Acute and chronic toxicity studies in animals to assess the safety of potential pharmaceuticals

name: Gastrointestinal Disease Models
definition: Research into drug development, mechanisms, and treatment strategies for diseases affecting the gastrointestinal system, such as inflammatory bowel disease and gastrointestinal cancers.

name: Rodent Models
definition: The most commonly used animals for studying disease and testing drugs.

name: Tissue Engineering
definition: Developmenet of biological substitutes that restore, maintain, or improve tissue function

name: Analysis of Cytokine Networks
definition: Analysis of cytokine networks refers to studying the interactions and regulatory mechanisms among different cytokines in a system.

name: Hit Identification
definition: Identification of active compounds from high-throughput screening (HTS) campaigns

name: Genetic and Genomic Biomarkers
definition: Analysis of genetic variants, gene expression patterns, and epigenetic modifications as biomarkers

name: Greenhouse Gas Assessments
definition: Comprehensive evaluations of the sources and amounts of greenhouse gas emissions associated with a specific entity or activity

name: Oncology and Cancer Biology Cell Line Development
definition: Cancer cell line development and maintenance; assays for studying cancer cell proliferation, survival, metastasis, and drug resistance

name: Gene Editing of Immune Cells
definition: Techniques like CRISPR/Cas9 for modifying immune cells

name: Animal Models for Depression, Anxiety, Schizophrenia
definition: Experimental animal models used to study the underlying mechanisms, behavioral manifestations, and potential treatments for mental health disorders such as depression, anxiety, and schizophrenia

name: Dynamic Light Scattering (DLS)
definition: A technique used to measure the size distribution and stability of particles in a solution, such as proteins, nanoparticles, and polymers, by analyzing the scattering of light caused by their Brownian motion.

name: Thin layer chromatography (TLC)
definition: Analytical technique used to separate and identify compounds in a mixture, involving the movement of a solvent across a thin layer of adsorbent material, such as silica gel, on a glass or plastic plate.

name: Potency Assays (e.g., Cell-Based Assays)
definition: Tests designed to measure the biological activity and effectiveness of therapeutics, often using living cells to evaluate the potency and functionality of drugs or vaccines.

name: Polyclonal Antibody Production
definition: Generation of antibodies targeting multiple epitopes on an antigen

name: In Situ Hybridization (ISH)
definition: Detection and localization of specific nucleic acid sequences directly within tissue sections

name: Protein Detection
definition: E.g, Western blot, ELISA, Flow Cytometry

name: Custom API Synthesis
definition: The tailored production of active pharmaceutical ingredients based on specific client requirements, including unique chemical structures, quantities, and quality standards.

name: Aseptic Processing
definition: The production method that maintains sterile conditions throughout the manufacturing process to ensure that the final drug product is free from microbial contamination.

name: Cell Culture
definition: Primary cell culture and cell line development for various cell types; 3D cell culture systems

name: Pharmacometabolomics
definition: Analysis of metabolite profiles in response to drug treatment

name: Transcriptomics Data Analysis
definition: Analysis of RNA-Seq data for differential gene expression

name: Behavioral Testing
definition: Studies for cognitive function, executive function, mood assessment

name: Histopathology
definition: Microscopic examination of tissue samples to analyze structure and identify abnormalities

name: Clinical Data Management
definition: Collection, cleaning, and management of clinical trial data, ensuring accuracy and integrity using electronic data capture (EDC) systems.

name: Pathway Engineering
definition: Design and optimization of metabolic pathways for the production of pharmaceuticals, biofuels, and industrial chemicals

name: Antibody Humanization
definition: The modification of non-human antibodies to make them more similar to human antibodies, reducing the risk of immune reactions and improving their efficacy and safety for therapeutic use in humans.

name: In Vivo Gene Therapy Studies
definition: Evaluating the efficacy and safety of the gene therapy candidate in animal models

name: In Vitro Preclinical Studies for Nutraceuticals
definition: In vitro studies for toxicology assessments and mechanism of action of nutraceutical ingredients

name: T Cell Receptor (TCR) Profiling
definition: Analyzing the diversity and specificity of T cell receptors within a sample, providing insights into the immune repertoire, immune response, and potential targets for immunotherapy.

name: Toxicogenomics
definition: Study of how genetic variations influence individual responses to toxicants

name: Novel Compound Synthesis
definition: Custom synthesis of small molecules, including complex organic compounds

name: Flow Cytometry of Immune Cells
definition: For immune cell phenotyping and sorting

name: Plasmid DNA Manufacturing
definition: Production of high-quality plasmid DNA encoding the therapeutic gene for vector production

name: Single-Cell Sequencing
definition: Sequencing and analysis of individual cells for high-resolution genomic insights

name: Functional Analysis and Characterization of Therapeutic Proteins
definition: Comprehensive assessment of therapeutic proteins' biological activity, stability, and physicochemical properties to ensure their efficacy, safety, and quality for clinical use.

name: High Resolution Imaging
definition: For obtaining high resolution and depth of field images of a sample surface

name: Metabolomics Data Analysis
definition: Interpreting complex data from the study of metabolites, the small molecule chemicals in biological systems.

name: Machine Learning and Predictive Modeling
definition: Application of machine learning algorithms for pattern recognition and predictive modeling

name: Drug Optimization
definition: Optimization of pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic properties of drug candidates

name: Clinical Supply Chain Management
definition: Management of the logistics related to the clinical trial supplies, including drug procurement, storage, and distribution.

name: cDNA synthesis
definition: The process of synthesizing complementary DNA (cDNA) from an RNA template using reverse transcription, providing a stable and amplifiable copy of the RNA for various molecular biology applications such as cloning and gene expression analysis.

name: Physiochemical Property Testing
definition: Including Thermal Gravimetric Analysis (TGA), Mercury Porosimetry (HgP), Surface Area & Porosity (BET), Melting Point (MP), Flash Point (FP), Coupon Corrosivity (CORR), Viscosity (VISC), Laser Light Scattering (LLS), Dynamic Vapor Sorption (DVS)

name: Spatial Transcriptomics
definition: A technique that combines histology and RNA sequencing to map gene expression within the spatial context of tissue sections, providing insights into cellular functions and interactions in their native environment.

name: Transcriptome Assembly
definition: Transcriptome assembly involves piecing together sequences of RNA transcripts to study the full range of expressed genes in a cell or organism.

name: Stroke and Cerebral Ischemia Animal Models
definition: Experimental animal models used to study the mechanisms, progression, and potential treatments for stroke and cerebral ischemia

name: Precision-Cut Tissue Slices
definition: Tissue slices maintained in a way that preserves their physiological function for studying drug metabolism and toxicity.

name: API Scale-Up Synthesis
definition: Process and technology transfer from lab scale to pilot and production scale

name: Clinical Packaging and Labeling
definition: The design, production, and labeling of packaging for clinical trial materials, ensuring that packaging meets regulatory requirements, maintains product integrity, and provides clear, accurate information for trial participants and staff.

name: Genomic Data Analysis
definition: Analysis of data from whole-genome sequencing, exome sequencing, and targeted sequencing

name: Immune Cell Isolation
definition: The process of separating specific immune cell types, such as peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs), T cells, B cells, and natural killer (NK) cells, from a heterogeneous cell population

name: FFPE Block Embedding
definition: The technique of embedding formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) tissue samples into paraffin blocks, which preserves the tissue architecture and allows for long-term storage and subsequent histological analysis.

name: Nutraceutical Safety Testing
definition: The assessment of the safety and efficacy of nutraceuticals through rigorous testing protocols, including toxicity studies, quality control, and regulatory compliance

name: Gene Therapy Vector Design and Development
definition: Selection of appropriate vector type (e.g., AAV, lentivirus) and engineering for optimal delivery and expression of the therapeutic gene

name: Chemical Synthesis Scale-Up
definition: For research or industrial applications, from laboratory to pilot and production scale

name: Near Infrared (NIR) and Ultraviolet / Visible (UV-VIS) Spectroscopy
definition: Analytical techniques that measure the absorption or reflectance of NIR and UV-VIS light by a sample, providing information on molecular composition, structure, and concentration.

name: Gastro-intestinal pathology
definition: The study and diagnosis of diseases affecting the gastrointestinal tract, involving the examination of tissue samples, endoscopic biopsies, and surgical specimens to identify conditions such as inflammation, infections, cancer, and other digestive disorders.

name: Organ-on-a-Chip
definition: Microfluidic devices that simulate the activities, mechanics, and physiological response of entire organs and organ systems.

name: Antibody Internalization Assays
definition: Techniques used to evaluate the ability of antibodies to be internalized by target cells

name: Antimicrobial Resistance Testing
definition: Detrmination of the susceptibility or resistance of specifci bacteria or fungi to antibiotics

name: Oligonucleotide Synthesis
definition: Synthesis of DNA and RNA oligonucleotides for research and therapeutic applications

name: Biocompatibility and Bioactivity Studies
definition: Development and testing of materials for tissue scaffolds

name: Chemokine Quantification and Profiling
definition: Chemokine quantification and profiling are the measurement and analysis of various chemokines in a given biological sample.

name: Protein Expression Analysis
definition: Mass spectrometry and 2D-gel electrophoresis for protein identification and quantification

name: Life Cycle Assessments (LCA)
definition: Assessing the environmental impact of products or processes over their entire life cycle

name: Antibody Proteomics
definition: Production and characterization of antibodies against specific proteins

name: AI-Driven Drug Discovery
definition: AI-driven drug discovery and precision medicine

name: Regenerative Medicine (Neuroscience)
definition: Studies on stem cell therapy and neurogenesis

name: Fluorescence Resonance Energy Transfer (FRET)
definition: For studying proximities and interactions of biomolecules

name: Raman Spectroscopy
definition: Non-destructive, vibrational spectroscopy for molecular identification and structural analysis

name: Non-Human Primate Models
definition: Used in research where closer physiological similarities to humans are required.

name: In Vitro Efficacy of Leads
definition: Biological assays to confirm and quantify the therapeutic effects of lead compounds in relevant disease models.

name: Prodrug Design
definition: Design of prodrugs to improve solubility, bioavailability, or targeting properties of active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs)

name: Non-Compartmental Analysis (NCA)
definition: A mathematical method used to estimate basic PK parameters

name: Clinical Trial Feasibility Studies
definition: Assessment of the feasibility of conducting a clinical trial, including site and investigator selection, patient population availability, and local regulations.

name: DNA Assembly
definition: Large scale DNA assembly for constructing synthetic genomes and complex genetic constructs

name: Surface Plasmon Resonance (SPR)
definition: Real-time monitoring of biomolecular interactions; kinetic analysis of binding affinities, rates, and specificities

name: Pathway Analysis and Metabolic Network Reconstruction
definition: Evaluating the interconnections and pathways among different metabolic and biological processes in an organism.

name: Protein Isolation
definition: Chromatographic techniques (affinity, ion exchange, size exclusion) for protein purification; tag removal and protein refolding services

name: Molecular Assay Development and Validation
definition: Developing and validating bioassays for drug screening, toxicity testing, molecular diagnostics, and specific research needs

name: Advanced Cell-Imaging Techniques
definition: Live-cell imaging for studying dynamic cellular processes; fluorescence microscopy, confocal microscopy, and high-resolution imaging

name: Protein X-ray Crystallography
definition: Determining 3D structures of proteins

name: Small-Angle X-ray Scattering (SAXS)
definition: Studies of protein folding, unfolding, and complex formation

name: Pharmacogenetics Analysis
definition: Pharmacogenetics analysis studies how genetic differences in individuals affect their response to drugs, aiming to personalize medicine.

name: Pharmacovigilance and Safety Monitoring
definition: Ongoing monitoring and reporting of adverse events, side effects, and other safety data during the clinical trial.

name: Mycology Services
definition: Antifungal susceptibility testing, fungal isolation, and identification of pathogenic and environmental fungi; antifungal susceptibility testing, fungal isolation, and identification

name: Necropsy Services
definition: Comprehensive post-mortem examinations in animals, including tissue collection for further histological and molecular analyses

name: Organotypic Cultures
definition: Maintaining an organ or tissue in a culture medium to study its native properties and responses.

name: Immunogenicity Assessment
definition: Testing the potential of a compound, especially biologics, to elicit an immune response.

name: Gut Immunity Animal Models
definition: Animal models used to study the immune system of the gastrointestinal tract, focusing on how it responds to various stimuli, pathogens, and treatments.

name: Isothermal Titration Calorimetry (ITC)
definition: Measurement of heat changes during molecular interactions

name: Endotoxin Testing
definition: Quality control testing assessing the microbial contamination of pharmaceutical products, medical devices, and other sterile environments

name: Drosophila Models
definition: The use of the fruit fly, Drosophila melanogaster, as a model organism in genetic and biomedical research, enabling the study of gene function, development, and disease mechanisms due to its genetic tractability and short life cycle.

name: Dose-Response Assessment
definition: Evaluation of quantitative relationship between the dose administered and the intensity of the PD effect

name: Nutritional Analysis
definition: Comprehensive nutritional analysis to determine the content of vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients

name: In Vivo Preclinical Studies for Nutraceuticals
definition: Animal studies to evaluate the biological activity and safety of nutraceutical ingredients

name: B Cell Immortalization
definition: Immortalization of B cells producing desired antibodies using Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) or other techniques

name: ADMET (Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism, Excretion, and Toxicity) Profiling
definition: Early evaluation of pharmacokinetic properties such as solubility, stability, permeability, metabolic stability, and toxicity in in vitro models

name: Analytical Method Development and Validation for Nutraceuticals
definition: Development of analytical methods for identifying and quantifying nutraceutical compounds, and validating to meet regulatory standards

name: Immune Checkpoint Studies
definition: Evaluation of checkpoint inhibitors in cancer immunotherapy

name: ELISA Assays
definition: ELISA assays are laboratory tests that use antibodies and color change to identify a substance, commonly used for detecting and quantifying proteins in samples.

name: Specialty Stains for Histopathology
definition: Specialized stains for specific tissues or biomarkers beyound H&E staining for detailed morphological and immunological analysis

name: Epigenomics Sequencing/Bisulfite Sequencing (Melthy-Seq)
definition: DNA methylation sequencing and histone modification profiling; chromatin accessibility assays (e.g., ATAC-seq) for understanding gene regulation

name: Metabolite Biomarker Discovery
definition: Identification and validation of metabolites as biomarkers

name: Cell Biobanking
definition: Preservation and storage of cell lines or primary cells for future research.

name: Integration of Multi-Omics Data
definition: Combining and analyzing data from different 'omics' fields (like genomics, proteomics, metabolomics) to gain a comprehensive biological understanding.

name: Protein Aggregation Assays
definition: Protein Aggregation Assays measure the formation of protein aggregates, a hallmark of many neurodegenerative diseases like Alzheimer's and Parkinson's.

name: Rodent Models for Carcinogenicity Studies
definition: For studying lifetime exposure and carcinogenic risk assessment

name: Fourier Transform Infrared (FTIR) Spectroscopy
definition: For binding studies, protein secondary structure analysis, and biomolecule normalization

name: C. elegans Models
definition: The use of the nematode Caenorhabditis elegans as a model organism in biological research, facilitating the study of genetics, development, and neurobiology due to its simple anatomy, well-mapped genome, and ease of genetic manipulation.

name: Companion Diagnostics
definition: Development of biomarker-based diagnostic tests that are paired with therapeutic drugs to determine their suitability for specific patients

name: API Bioavailability Studies
definition: Assessment of API availability at site of action to determine efficacy and safety profile

name: Medical Writing
definition: Preparation of clinical documents such as protocols, investigator brochures, consent forms, study reports, and regulatory submission documents.

name: Material Laser Processing and Die Cutting
Vetrinary Pathology
definition: The study and diagnosis of diseases in animals through the examination of tissue samples, organs, and bodily fluids

name: Virus-like Particle (VLP) Vector Production and Packaging
definition: Development and purification of VLP (virus-like particles) vectors and packaging of cargo into VLPs

name: Amino Acid Analysis (AAA)
definition: Determination of amino acid composition of samples containing proteins or amino acids

name: Swine Models
definition: The use of pigs in biomedical research as models for human diseases and conditions, owing to their physiological and anatomical similarities to humans, which make them valuable for studying cardiovascular diseases, organ transplantation, and surgical techniques.

name: Animal Model Housing
definition: The provision of specialized environments and care for laboratory animals used in research, ensuring appropriate conditions for their health and well-being, including regulated temperature, humidity, light cycles, and enrichment activities.

name: Custom Animal Model Development
definition: Developing specialized study designs and animal models tailored to specific research needs.

name: Genetically Engineered Animal Models
definition: Animals engineered to carry genes that cause or predispose them to specific diseases.

name: Pharmacokinetic/Pharmacodynamic (PK/PD) Animal Models
definition: These models are used to understand the dynamics of drug absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion, as well as the drug's biochemical and physiological effects.

name: Quality Management Systems (QMS) and Quality Assurance (QA)
Phase IV, Real-World Evidence and Registry
Topical and Inhalation Safety and Tolerability Studies
Protein Engineering
definition: Use of directed evolution and rational design to create proteins with enhanced properties or new functionalities

name: Thermal Shift Assay (TSA)
definition: Assessment of the thermal stability of proteins

name: Clinical Pharmacokinetics
definition: Studies during clinical trials to inform dosing regimens and therapeutic strategies

name: Soil Fertility Analysis
definition: Evaluation of the health and nutrient content of soil

name: Agriculture and Live Stock Genotyping
definition: The use of genetic testing to analyze and identify genetic variations in crops and livestock, aiding in breeding programs, trait selection, and improving productivity and disease resistance.

name: Crop Genetic Improvement
definition: The application of genetic tools and techniques to enhance crop traits such as yield, disease resistance, and environmental adaptability, contributing to agricultural productivity and sustainability.

name: Raw Material Sourcing
definition: The process of identifying, procuring, and managing the supply of raw materials needed for production or research

name: AI-Driven Antibody Design
definition: The use of artificial intelligence and machine learning to predict and optimize antibody structures, improve binding affinity and specificity, and accelerate the development of therapeutic antibodies by analyzing vast datasets and modeling interactions.

name: Hybridoma sequencing
definition: The sequencing of hybridoma cells, which are created by fusing antibody-producing B cells with myeloma cells, to determine the genetic sequences of the antibodies they produce

name: Ribosome Profiling (Ribo-Seq)
definition: Genome-wide analysis of ribosome positions to study translation

name: Bioprocess Development
definition: Conducting studies to validate that the bioprocess consistently produces a product meeting its predetermined specifications and quality attributes.

name: Semi-Solid Dosage Forms
definition: The production of semi-solid formulations such as creams and ointments, intended for topical application to deliver drugs effectively to the skin or mucous membranes.

name: Inhalation Products
definition: The development of drug products designed for inhalation, such as metered-dose inhalers (MDIs) or dry powder inhalers (DPIs), to treat respiratory conditions directly at the site of action in the lungs.

name: Large Molecule Analysis
definition: Analyzing proteins, peptides, and antibodies using techniques like ELISA, immunoassays, and mass spectrometry

name: Digital Pathology
definition: Digital scanning of whole slide images of tissue sections for remote and quantitative analysis

name: Nanomaterials Applications
definition: Studies on the application of nanomaterials in drug delivery, imaging, and sensors

name: FFPE Sample Isolation
definition: Extraction of nucleic acids from formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded blocks

name: In Vitro Fertilization
definition: A reproductive technology involving the laboratory-based fertilization of eggs and sperm, followed by implantation of the embryo into the uterus to assist with conception.

name: Custom Vector and Plasmid Construction
definition: Design and assembly of custom vectors for gene expression, cloning, and other applications

name: DNA Sequencing and Genotyping
definition: Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) for whole-genome, exome, and targeted sequencing, Sanger sequencing, nanopore

name: Biodiversity Studies
definition: Studies on the impact of human activities on biodiversity

name: Forensic Lab Material and Component Testing
Biologics Bioanalytical Services
definition: Laboratory services for analyzing biological samples.

name: Phylogenetic Studies
definition: Phylogenetic studies involve analyzing the evolutionary relationships among species or genes based on genetic data.

name: ATAC-Seq Chromatin Accessibility Studies
definition: Analyzing chromatin accessibility and gene regulation using Assay for Transposase-Accessible Chromatin using sequencing.

name: Neurological Biomarker Research
definition: Identification and validation of biomarkers for diagnosis and progression of neurological diseases

name: First-in-Human (FIH) PK/PD Studies
definition: Initial human studies to evaluate safety, tolerability, PK, and PD of a drug

name: SILAC (Stable Isotope Labeling by Amino acids in Cell Culture)
definition: Performing comparative quantitation

name: Biologics Formulation Development
definition: Stabilizing the final product in a suitable formulation that ensures its stability, efficacy, and safety during storage and use.

name: Expression Pathway Analysis
definition: The study of gene expression and biological pathways to understand the functional relationships and regulatory mechanisms in cells or organisms.

name: Metabolite Profiling Data by Mass Spectrometry
definition: Utilizing mass spectrometry to analyze and quantify metabolites in a sample, providing insights into metabolic changes.

name: In Vivo Autoimmunity Models
definition: Animal models for acute and chronic inflammation studies

name: Fungal Identification
definition: Identification and characterization of fungi using traditional culture techniques and modern molecular methods,  including ITS sequencing

name: Ocular Disease Models
definition: Services for developing and testing treatments for diseases of the eye

name: Toxicology Screening
definition: Early-stage toxicological evaluations to identify and mitigate safety risks

name: Drug Design
definition: Rational design of new drug candidates using structure-activity relationships (SAR) and structure-based drug design (SBDD)

name: Product Formulation and Development
definition: Design and development of nutraceutical formulations, including vitamins, minerals, herbs, and other dietary supplements

name: Preclinical PK/PD Modeling
definition: Use of animal models to predict human pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics

name: Central Laboratory Services
definition: Providing standardized laboratory testing for clinical trial samples on a global scale.

name: Clinical Monitoring
definition: On-site and remote monitoring to ensure the conduct of the trial is in compliance with the protocol, standard operating procedures, and regulatory requirements.

name: Genome Engineering
definition: Genetic modification of organisms for research or biotechnological applications

name: COVID-19 Testing
definition: Diagnostic assays to detect the presence of SARS-CoV-2, the virus causing COVID-19, using methods such as PCR, antigen tests, or serological assays.

name: Antimicrobial/Preservative Effectiveness Testing
definition: Evaluation of the effectiveness of antimicrobial agents or preservatives in preventing microbial growth in products, ensuring their safety and longevity.

name: Microbiological Testing
definition: The assessment of products and environments for microbial contamination, including the detection and quantification of bacteria, fungi, and other microorganisms to ensure product safety and compliance.

name: Systematic Evolution of Ligands by EXponential Enrichment (SELEX)
Gamma Sterilization
definition: The use of gamma radiation to sterilize medical devices, pharmaceuticals, or other products, providing an effective method for ensuring sterility and safety.

name: Ethylene Oxide (EO) Residue Testing
definition: The analysis of residual ethylene oxide (EO) levels on sterilized products to ensure that they are within acceptable limits and do not pose a risk to health.

name: De Novo Protein Sequencing
definition: Determination of an unknown protein's amino acid sequence without prior knowledge of the DNA sequence

name: Peptide Library Synthesis
definition: Synthesis of diverse collections of peptides with systematic variations

name: Solid-Phase Peptide Synthesis
definition: A method where the peptide chain is assembled on a solid support, allowing for easy separation and purification of the peptide.

name: Bone Marrow Toxicity and Stem Cell Hematotoxicity
Neuroprotection
definition: Studies on neuroprotective agents and oxidative stress markers

name: Gene Synthesis
definition: Synthesis of longer DNA sequences

name: Genotoxicity Testing
definition: Assessing potential for DNA damage and mutagenic effects (Ames test, micronucleus assay, comet assay, and chromosomal aberration tests)

name: RNA Extraction
definition: Isolating RNA from biological samples, ensuring the purity and integrity of the RNA for subsequent applications such as reverse transcription, quantitative PCR, and RNA sequencing.

name: Lead Formulation Studies
definition: Studies of suitable formulations for oral, topical, or parenteral administration

name: Bacterial Genome Sequencing
definition: Comprehensive sequencing of bacterial genomes

name: Genito-urinary pathology
definition: The study and diagnosis of diseases affecting the genital and urinary systems, involving the analysis of tissue samples and biopsies to identify conditions such as infections, cancers, and structural abnormalities.

name: Tissue Grossing and Cassetting
definition: The process of examining, measuring, and cutting tissue specimens to prepare them for histological processing, including placing the tissue samples into cassettes for further analysis and diagnosis.

name: Sterility Testing
definition: A set of procedures used to detect the presence of microorganisms in pharmaceutical products, medical devices, or other sterile materials, ensuring that the products meet required sterility standards and are safe for use.

name: Pattern Recognition Receptor Analysis
definition: This refers to examining receptors in the immune system that identify molecular patterns typical of pathogens, thus initiating an immune response.

name: Gene Expression Measurements
definition: Utilizing technologies such as qPCR, RNA-seq, ddPCR, and microarrays to quantify and analyze gene expression levels for research and clinical studies.

name: Protein Characterization
definition: Mass spectrometry; circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopy; dynamic light scattering (DLS) and Size Exclusion Chromatography-Multi-Angle Light Scattering (SEC-MALS)

name: Medicinal Chemistry
definition: Structural modification of lead compounds to improve potency, selectivity, and drug-like properties

name: Epigenomics Data Analysis
definition: Analyzing data related to the epigenome, which encompasses all the chemical modifications to the DNA and histones that regulate gene expression.

name: Animal Models for Acute and Chronic Pain
definition: Experimental animal models designed to mimic conditions of acute and chronic pain, used to study pain mechanisms, evaluate analgesic efficacy, and develop new pain management therapies.

name: In Vitro Permeability Assays
definition: Measuring the ability of drugs to pass through biological membranes (e.g., Caco-2 cell assay)

name: Extraction and Purification of Natural Compounds
definition: Development of methods for extracting bioactive compounds from natural sources, including purification and concentration

name: Antibody Fragmentation
definition: The process of breaking down antibodies into smaller fragments, such as Fab or F(ab')₂ fragments, to enhance their therapeutic properties, improve tissue penetration, or facilitate targeted delivery in various research and clinical applications.

name: Chiral Synthesis
definition: Specializing in the synthesis of chiral molecules, which are important in many pharmaceuticals

name: Immunohistochemistry (IHC)
definition: Detection and localization of specific antigens in tissue sections using antibodies

name: Phosphospecific antibodies
definition: Antibodies designed to specifically recognize and bind to phosphorylated forms of proteins, enabling the study of phosphorylation events and signaling pathways in various biological processes and disease states.

name: Nucleotide Chemistry
definition: Synthesis and modification of nucleotides and nucleotide analogs for therapeutic applications

name: Climate Change Studies
definition: Research on the effects of climate change on ecosystems, species, and environmental processes

name: Epigenetics Studies
definition: Analysis of DNA methylation and histone modifications; chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) assays

name: Nanomaterials Development
definition: Synthesis and characterization of nanomaterials like nanoparticles, nanocomposites, and nanocoatings

name: Metagenomics Sequencing
definition: Identification, sequencing, and analysis of microbial communities from environmental or clinical samples

name: Protein Cryo-Electron Microscopy (Cryo-EM)
definition: Structural analysis of large protein complexes

name: NMR-Based Metabolomics
definition: Use of Nuclear Magnetic Resonance for metabolite profiling, offering detailed structural information

name: X-ray Crystallography
definition: Determination of the atomic structure of crystalline molecules for in-depth structural analysis of proteins, nucleic acids, and other moleclar complexes

name: Genomic Variant Calling
definition: Process of identifying variations in the genetic sequence from genomic data, such as DNA sequencing.

name: Lead Generation
definition: Generation and optimization of lead compounds with desired biological activity

name: Excretion Studies
definition: Determining the routes and rates of drug elimination from the body

name: NIPT (Non-Invasive Prenatal Testing)
definition: A prenatal screening method that analyzes fetal DNA in the mother's blood to assess the risk of chromosomal abnormalities, such as Down syndrome, without invasive procedures.

name: Vaccine Development and Testing
definition: Preclinical development and testing of novel vaccines

name: Drug-Drug Interaction Studies
definition: Evaluation of the impact of co-administered drugs on ADME processes

name: Proteome Profiling
definition: Comparing protein expression across samples

name: Post-Market Medical Device Surveillance
definition: For post-approval continuous monitoring the safety and performance

name: Risk Assessment and Data Analysis
definition: Interpretation of toxicological data and risk assessment for human health

name: Compartmental Modeling
definition: A mathematical method used to model the distribution and elimination of a drug in the body using mathematical compartments

name: Biologics Purification Process Development
definition: Designing methods for separating the biologic product from cellular and media components

name: Nutritional Content Analysis
definition: The assessment of food products to determine their nutritional composition, including the levels of vitamins, minerals, proteins, fats, and carbohydrates, to verify label accuracy and support dietary recommendations.

name: Animal Feed Analysis
definition: The evaluation of animal feed for its nutritional content, quality, and safety, ensuring that it meets the dietary needs of livestock and complies with regulatory standards.

name: Bioavailability Profiling and Enhancement
definition: Formulation Strategies for Improved Absorption: Techniques such as salt formation, complexation, or prodrug approaches to enhance drug absorption

name: Stability Testing and Shelf-Life Studies
definition: Assessing the stability of drug products under various conditions to ensure their quality and safety

name: Nanoparticle Formulation
definition: The design and development of nanoparticles for use in drug delivery, imaging, or diagnostic applications, focusing on optimizing their size, surface properties, and functionality.

name: Injectable Products
definition: The manufacturing of injectable drug products, including those packaged in vials or pre-filled syringes, designed for precise dosing and safe administration.

name: Transdermal Patches
definition: The design and production of adhesive patches that deliver medication through the skin over a specified period, providing a controlled and sustained release of the drug.

name: Air Quality Studies
definition: Monitoring and analysis of air pollutants, including particulate matter, volatile organic compounds (VOCs), and greenhouse gases

name: Acid Cleaning
definition: The use of acidic solutions to remove inorganic contaminants, such as mineral deposits or rust, from equipment and surfaces to maintain cleanliness and prevent contamination.

name: Quality Audits and Inspections
definition: Systematic evaluations of manufacturing processes, facilities, and quality systems to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements, identifying areas for improvement and ensuring overall product quality.

name: Cytotoxicity Assays
definition: Cytotoxicity assays are used to measure the ability of a substance to kill or inhibit the growth of cells, commonly used in toxicity testing and drug development.

name: Particle Size, Shape, Count, and Stability
Conservation Studies
definition: Research on the conservation of species and habitats

name: Dermatopathology
definition: Microscopic examination of skin biopsies

name: Stem Cell Research
definition: Culturing and differentiation of embryonic and adult stem cells; induced Pluripotent Stem Cell (iPSC) technology

name: Protein-Protein and Protein-Ligand Interaction Studies
definition: Surface Plasmon Resonance (SPR) and Isothermal Titration Calorimetry (ITC); co-immunoprecipitation and pull-down assays; Fluorescence Resonance Energy Transfer (FRET) and Bioluminescence Resonance Energy Transfer (BRET) assays

name: Large-Scale Chemical Synthesis
definition: Synthesizing chemicals and scaling up production for larger studies or preclinical testing.

name: Biofilm Studies
definition: Evaluation of biofilm formation and testing of anti-biofilm agents; studies on biofilm physiology, genetics, and resistance mechanisms

name: Validation of Cleaning Processes
definition: Quality control testing assessing the microbial contamination of pharmaceutical products, medical devices, and other sterile environments

name: Drug Synthesis Scale-Up
definition: Scale-up synthesis for larger quantity production for advanced testing

name: Structure-Activity Relationship (SAR) Analysis
definition: Systematic modification of chemical structures to study the effects on biological activity

name: Clinical Trial Project Management
definition: Coordination and oversight of all aspects of the clinical trial, ensuring milestones are met within timelines and budgets.

name: Sample Identification/Fingerprinting
definition: Techniques used to verify the identity and purity of biological samples through unique genetic or molecular markers

name: Cytokine Quantification and Profiling
definition: Cytokine quantification and profiling involve measuring and analyzing the levels of various cytokines in a sample.

name: Biologics Scale-Up Strategies
definition: Developing strategies to increase production scale from laboratory to industrial scale while maintaining product quality.

name: Protein Separation and Characterization
definition: Chromatography (e.g., HPLC) for protein purification and analysis

name: Biomolecular Modeling and Simulation
definition: Computational modeling and molecular dynamics simulations for structure prediction and functional analysis, and  in silico docking studies for drug discovery

name: Custom Chemical Synthesis
definition: Custom synthesis refers to the specialized creation of unique chemical compounds on demand for specific research or industrial purposes.

name: X-ray Powder Diffraction (XRPD)
definition: For phase identification of a crystalline material

name: Induced Disease Models
definition: Animals in which disease is induced artificially to study its progression and treatment.

name: Lead Bioavailability Studies
definition: Improving the solubility and stability of lead compounds

name: Chemical Library Development
definition: Creation of diverse compound libraries for screening purposes

name: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Simulation
definition: Simulation studies for dose optimization and to minimize potential risks

name: Bioequivalence Studies
definition: Assessment of therapeutic equivalance of drug products, particularly in the development of generic drugs

name: Clinical Trials Management
definition: Comprehensive management of Phase I-IV clinical trials, including trial design, planning, execution, monitoring, and close-out.

name: Biostatistics and Statistical Programming for Clinical Trials
definition: Statistical analysis planning, execution, and reporting of clinical trial data, including the use of advanced statistical software.

name: Regulatory and Compliance Method Development
definition: The creation of analytical methods that meet regulatory requirements for drug development and manufacturing, ensuring compliance with industry standards and guidelines.

name: Environmental Monitoring of Cleanrooms
definition: The continuous or periodic assessment of cleanroom environments to detect contaminants, such as particles or microorganisms, ensuring that they meet cleanliness and safety standards.

name: Regulatory Compliance and Audit Support
definition: Assistance in navigating regulatory requirements and preparing for audits by regulatory agencies, ensuring that all processes and documentation meet legal and industry standards

name: Rodent Preservation
definition: The freezing and long-term storage of rodent models, including genetically modified strains.

name: In-Process and Release Testing
definition: Testing conducted during and after the manufacturing process to ensure that products meet predefined quality standards before they are released for distribution.

name: In Vitro High-Throughput Screening (HTS)
definition: Using automated technologies to rapidly test thousands to millions of compounds for activity against a target.

name: Infectious Disease Models
definition: Research into pharmacological strategies for the treatment and prevention of infections caused by various pathogens, including bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites.

name: Small Molecule Process Optimization
definition: The refinement and enhancement of chemical synthesis processes for small molecule APIs to improve yield, purity, and cost-effectiveness while ensuring regulatory compliance.

name: High Potency Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient (HPAPI) Handling
definition: The specialized handling, manufacturing, and containment of highly potent APIs, requiring stringent safety measures to ensure worker protection and product integrity.
